Participants.evidence: Blood from seven patients (150 mL per patient) was driven through the circuit for 10 min at 300 mL/min.

Intervention.evidence: Here we explored a novel disposable remover to remove inflammatory leukocytes in order to reduce risk of complications after CPB.

Objective.evidence: Here we explored a novel disposable remover to remove inflammatory leukocytes in order to reduce risk of complications after CPB.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Counts of leukocytes and their surface molecules were examined before circulation and after 2.5, 5, 7.5, and 10 min of circulation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Blood from seven patients (150 mL per patient) was driven through the circuit for 10 min at 300 mL/min.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Counts of neutrophils and neutrophils expressing the activation markers CD11b, CD54, CD64 or CD181 decreased rapidly by 36–39% during the first 2.5 min of circulation, after which their counts decreased more slowly.

Trial_Registration.evidence: This substudy is part of a prospective cohort study registered at the Clinical Trials Registry ( NCT05400356 ) on 27 May 2022.
